content_index.sheet_name: Improve My Relationship with My Child

Improve My Relationship with My Child.module_name: Spend One-on-One Time with My Child
Improve My Relationship with My Child.introduction.msg_list: Today’s lesson is about spending one-on-one time with Your Child 😃
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: When I spend special time with my child, I need to decide what we will do together.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🎉 You are right! 

🧸 Your child can choose the activity as long as it is safe. This will increase their confidence and make it more likely that they enjoy their time with you.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That's not actually true.

🧸 You do not have to plan an activity. Your child can lead! Let them choose as long as it is safe. This will increase their confidence and make it more likely that they enjoy their time with you.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.intro: {F1_SON_5} and his mother are playing dress up during one-on-one time. Let’s see how they have fun together:
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.1:
**{F1_MOTHER}**: “I have 5 minutes of one-on-one time to spend with you, {F1_SON_5}. What would you like to do?”

**{F1_SON_5}**: “I want to play dress up!”
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.2: **{F1_MOTHER}**: "Wonderful idea, {F1_SON_5}! I see you are taking out the yellow scarf with blue stripes on it.”
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.3:
**{F1_SON_5}**: "Mommy, it’s for you."

**{F1_MOTHER}**: "Thank you, I love it!"

**{F1_SON_5}**: "Wear it, Mommy!"
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.4: **{F1_MOTHER}**: “Look how good you are at getting dressed by yourself, {F1_SON_5}!”
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.intro: 3️⃣ Here are three tips to remember when spending one-on-one time with Your Child: DAY, PLAY, and STAY.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ *DAY - Try to do it every day*

⏰ Spend 5 minutes (or more!) with Your Child each day.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ *PLAY - Let them choose the activity*

⏰ Ask to spend time with Your Child.

⚽ Let them choose what to do or talk about.

🎈Try different activities together.

😃 Have fun!
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ *STAY - Focus on Your Child*

📺 Switch off the TV, put aside phones, and remove distractions.

👀 Look at Your Child. Nod or say “I see” to show you are really paying attention. 

💛 Accept your child and avoid judgment.

💡 Your Child may use gestures, full sentences, movements, and sounds to communicate with you. Respond to your child when they communicate with you. It shows you are really paying attention to them.

Improve My Relationship with My Child.home_activity.activity: Home Activity! ⭐ Try to spend at least 5 minutes of quality one-on-one time with Your Child every day. It will make such a difference! Do you have time to do it today? ⏰
Improve My Relationship with My Child.home_activity.positive_msg: Great! Use the tips you have learnt today, and have fun! Spending one-on-one time with Your Child is a great way to form a positive relationship with them. 💙
Improve My Relationship with My Child.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! If you don't have time today, set some time aside tomorrow.

Improve My Relationship with My Child.introduction.msg_list:
✨Well done for taking time to learn how to improve your relationship with Your Child. It shows you really care! 💙
;
😃How did the message above make you feel?

🌷We all feel better when we are praised.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.importance.msg_list:
🏅Praising Your Child when they behave well will make them want to behave that way more often. 

⭐It also creates a positive and loving relationship between you and Your Child.

Begin by praising Your Child during one-on-one time.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: The way you praise Your Child does not matter because any kind of praise is effective.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🎉 You are right! 

✨ How you praise your child is important. Praise should be specific, immediate, and genuine. 

🌱 You can begin by praising your child for the smallest things, such as playing by themselves quietly for 2 minutes.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That's not actually true.

✨ How you praise your child is important. Praise should be specific, immediate, and genuine. 

🌱 You can begin by praising your child for the smallest things, such as playing by themselves quietly for 2 minutes.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.intro: Let’s check in on another family to see how the mother praises her son, {F3_SON_4}, during one-on-one time.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.1: **{F3_MOTHER}**: “You found a striped sock and one with dots. Let’s find the socks that match those two.”
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.2: **{F3_MOTHER}**: “Another sock! This one is white. It isn’t easy finding a matching pair. It can be frustrating.”
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.3: **{F3_MOTHER}**: “You are being very patient and looking very hard, {F3_SON_4}. Well done for trying.”
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.4: **{F3_MOTHER}**: “You found two socks with the same pattern! Well done for looking, {F3_SON_4}!”
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.intro:
⭐ Children respond well to praise. When you praise Your Child for trying and for good behaviour, they will continue to behave well. 

4️⃣ Here are 4 simple tips for praising Your Child:
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ SEE IT

👀 Look for anything good or helpful that Your Child does.

⏸ Pause and really notice when they are doing something positive.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ SAY IT

🏆 Praise them when you see them do something you like.

✅ Tell them specifically what they have done well.

🎉 Be enthusiastic and really mean it!

🔄 This way, they are more likely to do it again.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ REPEAT IT

🌷 Look for something to praise Your Child for every day.

🔶 Even if it is something really small, keep doing it.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ KEEP IT POSITIVE

💡 Make sure you focus on something Your Child has done well.

🙂You can show your praise with a big smile and words. You can also clap or give Your Child a hug or high-five to show you appreciate them.

☀️ Keeping it positive reminds Your Child that you notice them and care.

Improve My Relationship with My Child.home_activity.positive_msg: Amazing! 🎉 Try to praise Your Child at least once during one-on-one time. You can also praise Your Child at other times during the day. Notice how they respond.

At the end of the day, think of all of the positive things that happened - this makes it easier to point them out. ☀️ With time, it will become easier for you to praise your child.

Improve My Relationship with My Child.module_name: Creating a Routine for One-on-One Time
Improve My Relationship with My Child.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about creating routines for spending one-on-one time with Your Child. 🔄
Improve My Relationship with My Child.importance.msg_list:
To continue building a positive relationship with Your Child, let’s make one-on-one time a part of the routine. 

You can use the tips in this lesson to create other daily routines with Your Child. 

Creating daily routines with Your Child will help them feel more calm and connected with you and behave better. 🔑

Help them plan time for resting, meals, chores, school, and sleep. ⏰
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.intro: {F2_GRANDMOTHER} spends one-on-one time with her granddaughter, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}, as part of her bedtime routine. Let’s see how they do it together!
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.1:
**{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: “I am so happy to see you playing quietly with your blocks, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}. When I come back, it will be time to get ready for bed. When you are ready for bed, we can have 5 minutes of one-on-one time together.”

**{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: “Okay!”
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.2: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: “Time to get ready for bed, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}. First, let’s get you nice and clean with a bath.”
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.3: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: “You were so well-behaved in the bath, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}. Now it is time to put your pyjamas on.”
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.4: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: “Well done for putting on your pyjamas by yourself, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}! Now let’s brush your teeth. Make sure you get the ones in the back of your mouth too!”
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.5:
**{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: “You did so well getting ready for bed! Now, we have 5 minutes of one-on-one time to spend together. What would you like to do?”

**{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: “Yay! Can you read me my favourite story?”
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.6:
**{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: “ “The end….” Such a lovely story! Goodnight, my baby girl. I love you very much.”

**{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: “Goodnight, {F2_GRANDMOTHER}.”
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.intro: Here are 3️⃣ tips on how to create routines with Your Child.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ BE A TEAM

🎈 Talk to Your Child about what they want their routines to look like.

✨ Did you know that Your Child is more likely to follow routines when they help to create them? Try it out! 💚
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ BE CONSISTENT

⏰ Make sure Your Child follows their routines daily.

🌱 Activities become easier when children learn and get used to a routine.

🔄 Consistent routines help Your Child learn how to do daily activities by themselves and how to manage their time.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ PRAISE, PRAISE, PRAISE

🏅Praise Your Child for creating a routine with you.

⭐ Praise Your Child when they follow the routine.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.4.text:
Here are some other routines you could talk about with Your Child in addition to one-on-one time:

✅ Bedtime
✅ Homework
✅ Chores
✅ Mealtime
✅ Free time
✅ TV or phone time

Improve My Relationship with My Child.home_activity.activity: Home Activity! Try to create a routine on how you can spend 5 minutes of one-on-one time with Your Child every day. 📝 Can you do it today?
Improve My Relationship with My Child.home_activity.positive_msg: That's great! Making one-on-one time a regular activity will mean a lot to Your Child. You can also make other routines with your child, like having a meal together or going for a walk. It will help your child feel connected to you and loved.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.home_activity.negative_msg:
That's OK! Beginning something new takes time. You might want to start with something simple, like connecting with Your Child at set times when you are already together. For example, when you are having dinner or doing chores. 

Ask Your Child for ideas on which routines could be useful for them. They might surprise you! ⏰🍚🚲

Improve My Relationship with My Child.introduction.msg_list: 😃😣😔This lesson is about noticing your and Your Child’s feelings during one-on-one time.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.importance.msg_list:
Noticing both your and Your Child's emotions will help you to look after and support yourself and your child well.

⭐ Noticing and Talking about feelings with Your Child will help them learn how to express and manage their emotions well. 

👌They will learn that all feelings are okay - even the difficult ones.
; 
🌷 You can help by listening to them, thinking about how it must feel for them, and accepting their emotions. 

🤗This will help them recognise other people’s feelings, too.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.question: Talking about happy feelings is not as important as sharing difficult feelings.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🎉That’s correct. 

6️⃣There are six basic emotions: Happy, Sad, Angry, Disgusted, Surprised, and Afraid. 

✅It’s important that we talk with our children about ALL of them.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That's not actually true.

6️⃣There are six basic emotions: Happy, Sad, Angry, Disgusted, Surprised, and Afraid. 

✅It’s important that we talk with our children about ALL of them.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.2.question:
Here’s another one: 
Boys should not share when they are feeling sad or afraid.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct:
🎉 You are right! 

⭐ It is important that both boys and girls learn how to share their feelings. 

💙 Children will learn that it is okay to feel sad or afraid and to ask for help when they need it.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That's not actually true.

⭐ It is important that both boys and girls learn how to share their feelings. 

💙 Children will learn that it is okay to feel sad or afraid and ask for help when they need it.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.3.question:
Last one:
 As parents, we can also share our feelings with our children.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct:
🎉 Correct! 

🌱 Sharing our feelings with our children in a calm way shows them how to do the same with their own feelings.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect:
👀Oops! Good Try!

🌱 Sharing our feelings with our children in a calm way shows them how to do the same with their own feelings.

Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.1:

Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.intro: 6️⃣ Here are 6 tips for how you can help Your Child learn how to cope with their emotions: LEARN, NOTICE, OPEN, TALK, SHARE and CARE
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ LEARN

💡 Learn about different emotions. There are 6 basic emotions that each send us a very specific message:  

😃Happy: Keep doing things that make you feel good.  

😔Sad: Something important in your life needs attention.

🔴Angry: Stand up for ourselves and set limits.
;
😣Disgusted: Move away from what we don't like.

👀Surprised: Stop and pay attention for a moment.

🚩Afraid: Run away from danger.

🎨 As children get older, they learn to identify lots of other emotions, like feeling excited, frustrated, proud, lonely, peaceful, guilty, or confused.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ NOTICE

👀 Begin observing these 6 emotions in yourself and in Your Child.
😃😒😔😣Notice how each emotion feels in your body.  
 
😃 You can also notice positive emotions such as a sense of peace, happiness, or calmness.
💙 Noticing can also help children appreciate a beautiful moment or feeling of love!
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ OPEN

Be open, notice 👀, and listen 👂 to Your Child when they share how they are feeling. 
💛 Accept how you and Your Child feel. Remember, your body and their body are sending messages about what you both are feeling, and those messages are important.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ TALK

😒 It is normal to struggle to talk about and express emotions and feelings. 

📝 Remember, it is also normal to experience feelings in different ways.

⭐ When Your Child is feeling an emotion, describe what you are observing in a calm way. For example, 

“I notice you’re stomping your feet, talking loudly, and your face looks a bit upset. Are you feeling angry because you didn’t get to play outside?”

You can also help Your Child learn different emotions by using facial expressions and physical movements. Make it into a game.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.5.text:
5️⃣ SHARE

😃 Share your own feelings with Your Child. For example, “I would feel the same way if I couldn’t go out when I wanted to.” 

 🎈This sets a good example and shows Your Child that it's okay to share their own feelings.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.6.text:
6️⃣ CARE

🌷 Use actions and words to make Your Child feel accepted and loved. 

⭐Jump with your child a little bit to shake out anger or take some deep breaths to calm down. These are some of the ways to deal with your emotions. 

💚 Remind Your Child that you are there for them and that they can always talk to you.

Improve My Relationship with My Child.module_name: Keeping Calm When We Are Stressed
Improve My Relationship with My Child.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about how we can stay calm and manage our anger when dealing with stressful moments with our children. 💚
Improve My Relationship with My Child.importance.msg_list:
As you began noticing feelings, you may have noticed feelings of anger, frustration or sadness. 

🌷 We love our children, but stress from caregiving and other events can make us feel angry. This is a normal part of life! 

💡 It is important for us to try to stay calm in order to help manage our anger so we do not hurt others.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.question: When I am angry at my child, I should show that I am angry so they stop misbehaving.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🎉 That’s correct! 

💛 It can be very difficult when your child is misbehaving, but you should try to manage your own stress and control your anger before doing anything. 

🌱 Taking deep breaths will help. Being angry may cause you to say or do things you will later regret.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
👀Oops! Good Try!

💛 It can be very difficult when your child is misbehaving, but you should try to manage your own stress and control your anger before doing anything. 

🌱 Taking deep breaths will help. Being angry may cause you to say or do things you will later regret.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.intro: {F2_GRANDFATHER} is about to spend one-on-one time with {F2_SON_8} but finds the living room in a mess. He notices that this makes him feel angry.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.1: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}** (thinking): “I’m feeling really angry. I am tired and my body feels tense. I just want to shout at {F2_SON_8}”.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.2: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}** (thinking): “I will Take a Pause and put on my favourite song.”
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.3: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}** (thinking): “I am feeling a little better. I can think more clearly about what to do to support my child.”
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.4: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: “{F2_SON_8}, well done for doing your homework. You might feel tired now. Let's take a 5-minute break, and after that, we can play a game together to quickly pick up the toys.”
Improve My Relationship with My Child.comic.text.5: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: “Thank you for doing your part to keep the house clean, {F2_SON_8}! I’m so proud of you for helping. Oh! It is our one-on-one time. What would you like to do?”
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.intro: There are 4️⃣steps to keeping calm in stressful situations: BE CALM, QUICK, CLEAR, and POSITIVE.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ *BE CALM*

✅ Be aware of your own feelings.

✅ Take a pause or a few breaths before asking Your Child to do something else.

✅ Speak with Your Child in a calm voice.

✅ Remember your goal: Make Your Child feel loved and connected to you.
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ *BE QUICK*

⏰ There are other things you can do to help manage unwanted behaviour before it becomes stressful. 

✨ Praise something positive that Your Child did today. 

✨ Understand their feelings. For example, it may feel boring to pick up toys after having fun or ending a big task. 
;
✨ When you see Your Child is about to start an unwanted behaviour, distract them by asking them to do something else, before the unwanted behaviour begins or gets worse. 

✨Invite Your Child in a chore you are doing. You can ask Your Child to think of a fun and quick way of doing the chores differently. 

💡 Preventing unwanted behaviour is much easier than disciplining them after they have done something wrong!
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ *BE CLEAR*

✅ Rather than saying what you DON’T want, tell Your Child what you DO want them to do.

For example, say:

✨ “Please speak more softly.” 
(instead of “stop shouting”)

✨ “Remember to walk inside the house.”
(instead of “stop running”)

This way, it is easier for them to follow! ⭐
Improve My Relationship with My Child.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ *BE POSITIVE*

✅ Praise Your Child when they behave well!

✅ Invite Your Child to a positive activity when you see they are about to start an unwanted behaviour. 

✅ It will also help them know what you expect from them!
Improve My Relationship with My Child.video.message:
Here's a video that will help you stay calm when your child misbehaves. ☀️

1️⃣ BE CALM
2️⃣ BE QUICK

4️⃣ BE POSITIVE
Improve My Relationship with My Child.audio.message:

1️⃣ BE CALM

Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.introduction.msg_list: Today’s lesson is about teaching Your Child about ✅ safe and ❌ unsafe touch.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.importance.msg_list:
💡 It is normal to feel uncomfortable talking to children about abuse. 

❗ But there are some simple things that can help them understand when it is not OK to be touched, and what they should do if something ever happens. 

🔑 It lets them know that they are in control of who can touch their body and in what way. 

🌷 This prepares them to keep themselves safe throughout their lives!
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: Parents should wait until their children are school-aged before talking about risks of sexual abuse.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
⭐ That’s right. 

🌷 It is never too early to talk with your child about how to keep them safe from sexual abuse.

🧸 Even young children can learn about which parts of their body are private and which parts are public.

💡 They can also learn that it is important for them to tell you if anybody touches them in an inappropriate way.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That's not actually true.

🌷 It is never too early to talk with your child about how to keep them safe from sexual abuse.

🧸 Even young children can learn about which parts of their body are private and which parts are public.

💡 They can also learn that it is important for them to tell you if anybody touches them in an inappropriate way.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.2.values: Say they shouldn’t talk about those body parts | Appreciate them for being brave to share with you and report the person if necessary | Tell them not to lie about things like this | Go and shout at the person who did it
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.2.answer: Appreciate them for being brave to share with you and report the person if necessary
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct:
⭐ That’s right. 

💚 Thank them for being brave and for telling you so they feel safe to talk to you if anything ever happens again.

💡 This teaches them that their safety matters most.

❗ Confronting the person who did it often makes it worse, so it is better to help your child stay away from the person and report them to the police or at a clinic.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect:

Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.intro: {F1_FATHER} wants to help his young children learn about safe and unsafe touch. Let’s see how he has the conversation with his young son, {F1_SON_5}.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.1:
**{F1_FATHER}**: Did you enjoy the story, {F1_SON_5}?

**{F1_SON_5}**: Yes, {F1_FATHER}! It was fun!
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.2:
**{F1_FATHER}**:  Now, there are some important things I want to talk to you about. It's about keeping your body safe and healthy.

**{F1_SON_5}**: What do you mean, {F1_FATHER}?
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.3:
**{F1_FATHER}**: First, we all have private parts on our bodies. These are the parts that are covered by our underwear.

**{F1_SON_5}**: Like this? 

**{F1_FATHER}**: Exactly. It's important to remember that these parts are private, and no one should touch them except to keep you clean and healthy.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.4:
**{F1_FATHER}**: Your body belongs to you, and you have the right to say "no" if someone wants to touch you in a way that feels uncomfortable or wrong.

**{F1_SON_5}**: Okay, {F1_FATHER}.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.5:
**{F1_FATHER}**: And if anything ever happens that makes you feel scared or uneasy, remember you can always come and tell me or {F1_MOTHER}. We're here to protect you and keep you safe.

**{F1_SON_5}**: I will tell you and {F1_MOTHER}, {F1_FATHER}.

**{F1_FATHER}**: We love you, **{F1_SON_5}. Now, let's give each other a big hug!
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.intro: 4️⃣ Here are four tips to help you teach Your Child about safe and unsafe touch and what to do if they feel unsafe when someone touches them. 💛
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ LEARN ABOUT PRIVATE PARTS

✅ The parts of their body that go under their underwear or a swimsuit are private parts. 

❌ It is not OK for other people to touch or to ask to look at them, or ask them to look at or touch theirs.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ “NO” IS OK!

❌ Tell Your Child that they are always allowed to say no to someone touching them. This is true even for things like hugs!

👑 This teaches Your Child that they are always in control of who they allow to touch them so they can make safe choices throughout their lives, in any situation.

🚩 Practise saying “No, please don’t do that” and “No! Stop!” with Your Child, so they know how to do it if they need to.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ GET AWAY

💡 Always teach Your Child how to get away from any situation where they feel uncomfortable. 

🚩 Offenders are usually known to the child and/or caregivers and initially engage in physical activities like wrestling or touching. This is to get the child comfortable with touch.

❗ When playing physical games like wrestling  with your child, practice saying "no" and respecting their boundaries. If your child says "no", stop the game immediately.

🌷 This empowers them to say “NO!” to unsafe situations outside the home as well. It will not be as easy for the child to get away from such situations, but teaching them how to leave when they feel uncomfortable will help.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ TELL AN ADULT

🔴 Tell Your Child that if they feel worried, uncomfortable, or unsafe about anyone touching them, they should tell you or an adult they trust. Always believe your child when they tell you about someone touching them in an unsafe way.

👂 If Your Child tells you about something that has happened, listen openly and tell them they were right to tell you. Then, take steps to keep them safe, including not ever leaving them alone with anyone that makes them feel unsafe.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.video.message: ▶️ Press play to learn 4️⃣ four tips to help you teach Your Child about safe touch and what to do if they feel unsafe when someone touches them. 💛
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.audio.message: ▶️ Press play to learn 4️⃣ four tips to help you teach Your Child about safe touch and what to do if they feel unsafe when someone touches them. 💛

Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! If you don't have time today, set some time aside tomorrow. Talking to Your Child about this will help them protect themselves if they ever feel unsafe when somebody touches them. 💙 You’re doing so well!

Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.intro: 4️⃣  Here are four tips to help you teach Your Child about safe touch and what to do if they feel unsafe when someone touches them. 💛
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ BE HONEST

✅ Talk to your child about how to name each part of their body. If Your Child knows how their body works and where people should and should not touch them, they can make safer choices throughout their lives.

🔑 Answer any questions Your Child has honestly. These could be about any part of their own body or that of the other sex - even private parts!

💚 This teaches them it is safe to ask about the body, which means they will learn more and stay safer.

👀 Teaching Your Child about their whole body, even when young, means they will know how to talk about it if anything happens that they feel is unsafe.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ “NO” IS OK!

❌ Tell Your Child that they are always allowed to say no to someone touching them. This is true even for things like hugs!

👑 This teaches Your Child that they are always in control of who they allow to touch them so they can make safe choices throughout their lives, in any situation.

🚩 Practise saying “No, please don’t do that” and “No! Stop!” with Your Child, so they know how to do it if they need to.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ GET AWAY

🚲 Always teach Your Child how to get away from any situation where they feel uncomfortable. 

🚩 Offenders are usually known to the child and/or caregivers and initially engage in physical activities like wrestling or touching. This is to get the child comfortable with touch.

❗ When playing physical games like wrestling with your child, practice saying "no" and respecting their boundaries. If your child says "no", stop the game immediately.

🌷 This empowers them to say “NO!” to unsafe situations outside the home as well. It will not be as easy for the child to get away from such situations, but teaching them how to leave when they feel uncomfortable will help.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ TELL AN ADULT

🔴 Tell Your Child that if they feel worried, uncomfortable, or unsafe about anyone touching them, they should tell you or an adult they trust.

👂 If Your Child tells you about something that has happened, listen openly and tell them they were right to tell you. Then, take steps to keep them safe, including not ever leaving them alone with anyone that makes them feel unsafe.

Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about learning how to keep your children safe in your community. 🚩

Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.intro: Let’s test your knowledge about children’s safety.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.question: Which of these is NOT a place where children could experience harm?
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.values: Home | A friend’s house | Crèche | Church or mosque | Clinic | Park | Car | None of the Above
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
⭐ You are right! 

😔 Your child could experience harm in any of these places, even at home or at crèche. 

🌱 As caregivers, it is our job to teach them how to keep themselves safe wherever they are.

👀 Oops! That's not actually true.

😔 Your child could experience harm in any of these places, even at home or at crèche. 

🌱 As caregivers, it is our job to teach them how to keep themselves safe wherever they are.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct:
⭐ You’re correct! 

💡 It’s important to teach little ones about safety early on, even if they’re always with you. 

🔑 As caregivers, it is our job to help them learn how to stay safe everywhere.

Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.intro: Let’s check in on {F2_DAUGHTER_3} and her grandfather, who are playing together outside:
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.1: **{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: Look {F2_GRANDFATHER}, how far I can kick my ball!
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.3:
**{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: Remember what we talked about, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}. What should we do if the ball goes on the street? 

**{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: We should stay where we are and ask an adult for help.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.4: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: That’s right! I am so proud of you for remembering. Roads are for cars and bikes, and it is safer for an adult to get your ball for you.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.intro:
To keep Your Child safe, talk with them about which places are safe to go and which are not, and teach them how to be careful when they meet people they don't know.

4️⃣Here are four steps to help you keep Your Child safe in your community:
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.1.text:
Step 1️⃣: DRAW

📝 Draw a map of your community.

🚩 Include the main places in your community: your house, streets in your neighbourhood, crèche, and other places Your Child visits.

👋Draw and identify pictures of trusted people who Your Child can go to when they feel unsafe. These can be you and your partner, other family members, or teachers.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.2.text:
Step 2️⃣: TALK

🔑 Talk about the safe and unsafe places on your map. For example, let Your Child know that the street is not a safe place, even if their toy or ball goes there. 

🔵 CIRCLE the places that are safe for children.

❌ CROSS OFF any places that are unsafe for Your Child. For example, tuck shops, taxi ranks, or unfamiliar or unoccupied buildings.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.3.text:
Step 3️⃣: DISCUSS

❗ Discuss with Your Child why it is important to ALWAYS have an adult with them when they go outside. 

🧸Make sure Your Child knows it’s okay to walk or run inside if a stranger tries to talk to them or asks them to go somewhere. 

👀 Discuss with Your Child safe places they can run if a stranger approaches them – such as your home, or a neighbour’s home. 

🚩  Mark these areas clearly with a ⭐ star on your map.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.4.text:
Step 4️⃣: PRACTISE 

🔔Practise! Practise! Practise! 

👑 Using toys or teddy bears, role-play scenarios where a stranger approaches. Ask Your Child what the toy should do. Children find it less scary to pretend that someone else is in danger. 

⭐ Praise when Your Child chooses the correct response, such as running away, shouting for help, or finding a trusted adult.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.5.text: Talking about unsafe situations with Your Child might feel uncomfortable, but it's important. 💛 When children know what to do in a dangerous situation, they're much safer.

Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about learning how to keep your children safe in your community. 🚩
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.importance.msg_list: You are not alone! Parents all over the world say they worry about keeping their children safe. 🔔
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.intro: Let’s test your knowledge about children’s safety.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.question: Which of these is NOT a place where children could experience harm?
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.values: Home | A friend’s house | School | Church or mosque | Clinic | Park | Car | None of the Above
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
⭐ You are right! 

😔 Your child could experience harm in any of these places, even at home or at school. 

🌱 As caregivers, it is our job to teach them how to keep themselves safe wherever they are.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That's not actually true.

😔 Your child could experience harm in any of these places, even at home or at school. 

🌱 As caregivers, it is our job to teach them how to keep themselves safe wherever they are.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.intro: Let’s check in on {F2_SON_8} and his grandmother after {F2_SON_8} finds himself in an uncomfortable situation:
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.1:
**{F2_SON_8}**: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}, I was playing in the garden. Something happened!!

**{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: What is it, {F2_SON_8}!? Take a breath and tell me.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.2:
**{MAN_IN_CAR}**: Hi boy. You are so good at kicking that ball and you look so strong! I wish I could kick a ball like you. What’s your name?

**{F2_SON_8}**: My name is {F2_SON_8}.

**{MAN_IN_CAR}**: {F2_SON_8}, such a beautiful name.

**{F2_SON_8}**: Thank you.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.3:
**{MAN_IN_CAR}**: {F2_SON_8}, I have chips and some toys for you in my car. If you come in, you can eat chips and play with all the toys, I promise…

**{F2_SON_8}**: No, thank you.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.5: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: {F2_SON_8}, I’m so proud of you for not getting out of our yard and getting into the car. You remembered the rules we created about safety in this community. That was a dangerous situation. You are so brave. Thank you for telling me. I will report it so it doesn’t happen again.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.intro:
To keep Your Child safe, talk with them about which places are safe to go and which are not, and teach them how to be careful when they meet people they don't know.

4️⃣Here are four steps to help you keep Your Child safe in your community:
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.1.text:
Step 1️⃣: DRAW

📝 Draw a map of your community.
🚩 Include the main places: streets, your house, school, shops, and other places Your Child visits.
👋Draw and identify pictures of trusted people who Your Child can go to when they feel unsafe. These can be you and your spouse, other family members, or teachers.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.2.text:
Step 2️⃣: TALK

🔑 Talk about the places on your map and decide if they are safe or not.
👂 Listen to Your Child: it is important to understand why they think a place is safe or unsafe.
🔵 CIRCLE the places that are safe for children.
❌ CROSS OFF any places that are unsafe for Your Child. For example, tuck shops, taxi ranks, or unfamiliar or unoccupied buildings.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.3.text:
Step 3️⃣: DISCUSS

❗ Sometimes, we find ourselves in trouble.
🧸Make sure Your Child knows it’s okay to walk or run inside if a stranger tries to talk to them or asks them to go somewhere. 
👀 Discuss where you and Your Child can get support in a crisis. These places may include home, school, a police station, or a clinic. 
🚩 Mark these areas clearly with a ⭐ star on your map.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.4.text:
Step 4️⃣: PRACTISE 

🔔Practise! Practise! Practise! 
👑 Role-play scenarios where a stranger approaches using toy figures. Ask Your Child what the toy should do. Children find it less scary to pretend that someone else is in danger. 
⭐ Praise when Your Child chooses the correct response, such as running away, shouting for help, or finding a trusted adult.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.5.text: Talking about unsafe situations with Your Child might feel uncomfortable, but it's important. 💛 When children know what to do in a dangerous situation, they're much safer.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.video.message:
To keep Your Child safe, talk with them about which places are safe to go and which are not, and teach them how to be careful when they meet people they don't know.

▶️ Press Play to learn the 4️⃣ four steps to keep Your Child safe in your community.

▶️ Press Play to learn the 4️⃣ four steps to keep Your Child safe in your community.

Home activity! ⭐
 
📝 Today, have a conversation with Your Child about which places are safe or unsafe for children in your community.

✨ Give space for your child to share their thoughts, too. They may think a place is unsafe that you thought was safe. Allow them to explain their reasons. Do you have time to do it today? ⏰

Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! If you don't have time today, set some time aside tomorrow to talk to your child about safe and unsafe places. You can do this! 🌷

Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about learning how to respond when our children are in crisis.❗
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.importance.msg_list: When our children share something that is very hard or upsetting to them😔😣, we need to remember to stay calm, listen, and be open, so that they feel supported. 💛
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: When my child is upset, I should wait for them to come to me. I don’t want to upset them further by asking what is troubling them.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🌷 That’s right!

😣 When children are in crisis, they may be scared to tell others about it for many reasons. They may be worried about others judging them or getting angry. They may also feel shame.

💚 You can ask your child very calmly about why they seem upset. 👀

👂 Assure them that you are proud of how brave they are to share their crisis with you.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That's not actually true.

😣 When children are in crisis, they may be scared to tell others about it for many reasons. They may be worried about others judging them or getting angry. They may also feel shame.

💚 You can ask your child very calmly about why they seem upset. 👀

👂 Assure them that you are proud of how brave they are to share their crisis with you.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.intro: {F1_SON_5} looks upset. Let’s see how his father responds:
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.1:
**{F1_SON_5}**: I don't want to play with Daniel today.

**{F1_FATHER}**: What happened, {F1_SON_5}? I thought you and Daniel were friends. Do you want to talk about it?
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.2: **{F1_SON_5}** (crying): He and some of the other kids were mean to me. They said I was stupid because I can’t button my shirt properly.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.3:
**{F1_FATHER}** : Oh my {F1_SON_5}, that is not a very nice thing to say to someone. I can understand why you would feel upset about this. 
First of all, you are not stupid! I am so proud of how much you are growing and learning. It is important that Daniel and the others know that it is not okay to say mean things. Would you like me to come with you so that we can have a chat with the others together?

**{F1_SON_5}**: Okay…
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.4:
**{F1_FATHER}**: I can also have a chat with Daniel's parents to let them know. Daniel is a good boy and is usually nice to you so maybe there is something else happening.
Thank you for sharing with me, {F1_SON_5}. I am very proud of you.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.intro: 4️⃣ Here are four things you can do to support your child when they share something difficult with you:
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ BREATHE: Take a pause

🌱 Take a deep breath so you can respond calmly.
💛 Ask yourself, “What does my child need right now?”
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ LISTEN: Ask your child what is going on 

👂 Let your child share with you what they need. Sometimes, it may be easier for your child to draw what happened instead of explaining it. 
👀 Notice what they are feeling and tell them what you notice so they feel heard. 
💙 Tell your child that you are there for them and love them.
😣Both girls AND boys could face hard times and crisis situations. Remember to check-in with both.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ RESPOND: What might help?

🔶 You might need to help your child talk about their feelings. 
⏸ In the moment, your child needs you to be there for them with love and accept their feelings.
➡️ You might need to talk about the actions that you or your child could take to help with what has happened.
✅ Remember, you can always type {HELP} to ParentText and get information about resources in your community where you can receive help.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ COMFORT: Be there for your child

🌷 It can be hard to see your child feeling upset or confused, but there is a lot you can do to support them.
💚 They need you to accept them and comfort them when difficult things are going on.
🔄In these moments, maintaining a consistent routine can be particularly helpful. Familiar routines can provide a sense of security and normalcy, helping your child feel safe again.
🎈 Remind your child again that you love them, and thank them for sharing with you.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.video.message: ▶️ Press play to learn the 4️⃣ four things you can do to support your child when they share something difficult with you.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.audio.message: ▶️ Press play to learn the 4️⃣ four things you can do to support your child when they share something difficult with you.

Home Activity! ⭐ 

Find a calm time to look at the community map you created with your child during the previous tip. Talk about possible risks and what they could do to avoid them. Discuss possible actions that you can take with Your Child if they happen. 💡

Do you have time to do this today? ⏰
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.home_activity.positive_msg: Amazing! 💙 This can help prepare you and your child to face hard situations AND avoid them in the first place.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! 💙 Plan to set aside some time in the next few days to have this chat with your child. This can help prepare you and Your Child to face hard situations AND avoid them in the first place.

Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.intro: {F3_DAUGHTER_7} is in trouble. Let’s see how her mother responds:
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.1: **{F3_MOTHER}**: My dear, you look really upset, do you want to tell me what happened?
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.2:
**{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: It’s my uncle, he… he… he touched me.

**{F3_MOTHER}** (thinking): Take a deep breath... What does my child need? She needs me to be calm and listen. 

Come and sit down next to me. Take your time, I’m listening.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.3:
**{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: It’s true, he… he… made me very uncomfortable… he touched my body and told me I’d be in trouble if I told anybody! I didn’t want to do anything with him, and I even said NO, but he told me I would be in trouble.

**{F3_MOTHER}**: You are so brave for sharing this with me. You are not in trouble. This is not your fault. Thank you for telling me.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.4:
**{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: Yesterday, when you went to see your friend, he just came here and that’s when it happened.

**{F3_MOTHER}**: It’s okay, I believe you, {F3_DAUGHTER_7}. You have done the right thing telling me. What happened is not OK, but I am here for you to help you and support you.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.5:
**{F3_MOTHER}**: We will need to talk to someone who will help keep you safe. Would that be okay, {F3_DAUGHTER_7}? I will be with you the whole time.
**{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: Yes… Okay… where will we go?
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.6: **{F3_MOTHER}**: We can go to the clinic. And {F3_DAUGHTER_7} remember this is not your fault. I love you. We will get through this.

Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.introduction.msg_list:
This lesson is about how to keep Your Child safe online. 📱

There is so much to share. We will cover online safety over 2️⃣ two lessons.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.importance.msg_list: Children are spending a lot of time online.⏰ Being connected helps them stay positive and learn more 🔑 but there are also some risks and dangers.🚩
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: Parents should set time limits on how long their child can use the internet each day.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🎉 Correct! 

⏰ Setting time limits can help balance online activities with other important tasks, such as homework, chores, and physical activities.

📝 You can **create rules** together with Your Child about when they can play with devices and how to keep them safe online.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That’s not actually true.

⏰ Setting time limits can help balance online activities with other important tasks, such as homework, chores, and physical activities.

📝 You can **create rules** together with Your Child about when they can play with devices and how to keep them safe online.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.2.question:
Here is another question. 

True or False: If Your Child comes across something upsetting or uncomfortable online, they should keep it to themselves and not tell anyone.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct:
✨ Correct! 

💡 If Your Child encounters something online that upsets them, they should tell you immediately so you can address the issue and get support if needed.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That’s not actually true. 

💡 If Your Child encounters something online that upsets them, they should tell you immediately so you can address the issue and get support if needed.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.3.question:
One more! 

True or False: It is safe for young children to have their social media accounts without parental supervision.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct:
⭐ Correct! 

🔑 Social media platforms like YouTube have age restrictions for a reason.

👀 Young children should not have social media accounts without parental guidance and supervision, because they may see things or have conversations that are distressing or harmful.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That’s not actually true.

🔑 Social media platforms like YouTube have age restrictions for a reason.

👀 Young children should not have social media accounts without parental guidance and supervision, because they may see things or have conversations that are distressing or harmful.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.intro: {F2_SON_8} wants to play games on the phone. His grandfather uses this opportunity to teach {F2_SON_8} about how to stay safe online:
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.1:
**{F2_SON_8}**: Can I use the phone to play games?

**{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: Sure! But let’s first learn how to be safe when using phones or tablets. First, the household rule is that you can only use the phone or tablet for 30 minutes each day. It is the length of one episode of your favourite cartoon. I will set a timer that will go off when you have 5 minutes left.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.2:
**{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: Always ask me or {F2_GRANDMOTHER} for permission before using any device or downloading any app. You should also only play games or watch videos that we have approved, okay?

**{F2_SON_8}**: Okay, {F2_GRANDFATHER}!

**{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: You are a great listener!
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.3:
**{F2_SON_8}**: Can I create my own account for pictures and videos, Grandpa? {F2_DAUGHTER_17} has an account for herself.

**{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: We'll wait until you're a bit older, {F2_SON_8}. Social media is for older kids. What we can do is post pictures on my account together if you want.

**{F2_SON_8}**: Okay.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.4:
**{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: Thank you for understanding. And remember, never click on a pop-up or picture if it appears. Also, if anything ever upsets you, let us know right away. We're here to keep you safe! Let’s play for 5 minutes to practise what we agreed.

**{F2_SON_8}**: Yes, Grandpa! Thank you.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.intro:
Keeping Your Child safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world. 📱

Here are 4️⃣ tips that can help keep Your Child safe online: 
1️⃣ LEARN
2️⃣ PROTECT
3️⃣ BUILD HABITS
4️⃣ BUILD TRUST

🔑 Today, we are learning about LEARN and PROTECT. 

✨ The next lesson will cover BUILD HABITS and BUILD TRUST.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ **LEARN** the dangers of being online:

🚩 CONTENT: Your Child might come across harmful content or content you think is inappropriate for them, such as violence, aggressive language, or pornography.

🚩 CONTACT: Adults might pretend to be children and ask for sexual pictures or to meet with your child through an online platform.

🚩 CONDUCT: Sometimes, children or strangers can say or do hurtful things online.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ **PROTECT** - Keep your girl or boy safe online:

✅ Talk to Your Child about which apps and websites are safe and which are not. Discuss why!

✅ Help Your Child learn how to make strong passwords to protect their devices. 

✅ Tell Your Child that they should keep personal information private, including photos or videos of themselves. What goes online stays online!

Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.introduction.msg_list: This lesson continues our learning about keeping children safe online.📱
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.importance.msg_list:
The previous lesson taught you ways to protect Your Child online with 1️⃣ LEARN and 2️⃣ PROTECT.🔑

In this lesson, we will learn how to 3️⃣ BUILD HABITS and 4️⃣ BUILD TRUST. ✨
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.intro:
💡 Often, our children understand more about life online than we do, but that does not mean they know how to keep safe. 

⭐ Let’s test your online safety knowledge.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: If I send a picture to a friend, it will only be visible to them.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🎉 That’s correct. 

📱 Even in an app where images are temporary, your friend can capture their screen and save your image. 

🚩 Pictures are always stored online and can be accessed by hackers. 

❗ Remember, what goes online stays online!
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That’s not actually true.

📱 Even in an app where images are temporary, your friend can capture their screen and save your image. 

🚩 Pictures are always stored online and can be accessed by hackers. 

❗ Remember, what goes online stays online!
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.2.question:
Here is another question. 

True or False: My password is strong because you have to know my home address to guess it.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct:
✨ That’s correct. 

❗ Most passwords are hacked because someone accesses a list of home addresses, birth dates, names or phone numbers. 

🚩 You should never use these details in your password as they are easily guessed.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That’s not actually true.

❗ Most passwords are hacked because someone accesses a list of home addresses, birth dates, names or phone numbers. 

🚩 You should never use these details in your password as they are easily guessed.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.3.question:
One more! 

True or False: Links sent to me by my family and friends are safe to click on.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct:
🎈 That’s right! 

❗ Your family member’s email or phone account could be hacked. 

👀 Always double-check a link before clicking on it to make sure you’re visiting a trusted website. 

🔑 If you don’t recognise the web address, don’t click on it.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! That’s not actually true.

❗ Your family member’s email or phone account could be hacked. 

👀 Always double-check a link before clicking on it to make sure you’re visiting a trusted website. 

🔑 If you don’t recognise the web address, don’t click on it.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.intro:
Keeping Your Child safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world. 📱 

You already learned ways to protect Your Child online with 1️⃣ LEARN and 2️⃣ PROTECT in the previous lesson.

Today, we are learning how to 3️⃣ BUILD HABITS and 4️⃣ BUILD TRUST.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.1.text:
3️⃣ **BUILD HABITS** - Set up safe online habits at home: 

❌📱 Plan phone-free times in your house, like during meals, homework, or in bed.

❗ Set limits on the amount of time Your Child spends online. 

⭐ Only let Your Child chat online with people they already know. They should never share personal information in a chat room or with strangers.

👀 Before completing forms that ask for personal information, check that the web address begins with https://. Websites that begin with http:// may not be secure.

📝 For older children, you can help them create strong passwords for their accounts. They should be long, not include obvious personal information like your name or birthday, and include upper and lower case letters, numbers and symbols.

❗ Tell Your Child not to click on pop-ups that ask them to download or pay for anything.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.2.text:
4️⃣ **BUILD TRUST**

🌷 Together, look at websites, social media, games, and apps Your Child uses. 

👂 Ask questions - this helps you learn more about Your Child’s interests!

💙 If you come across anything worrying together, talk about it with your child. If you need support, type {HELP} after you complete today’s lesson.  

✅ Tell Your Child that they should tell an adult if they feel scared, unsafe or upset about something online.

🚩 Teach your child that if a stranger offers gifts, like virtual coins, in exchange for photos and personal information, and tells them to keep it a secret, they should tell you.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.video.message:
Keeping Your Child safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world.📱 

You already learned ways to protect your child online with 1️⃣ LEARN and 2️⃣ PROTECT in the previous lesson.

Here’s a 2nd video learning how to 3️⃣ BUILD HABITS and 4️⃣ BUILD TRUST.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.audio.message:
Keeping Your Child safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world.📱 

You already learned ways to protect your child online with 1️⃣ LEARN and 2️⃣ PROTECT in the previous lesson.

▶️ Press play to learn how to 3️⃣ BUILD HABITS and 4️⃣ BUILD TRUST.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.home_activity.activity:
Home activity!⭐ Here are some steps you can take to keep Your Child safe online today:

 📝 Have a conversation with Your Child about how they can use the internet and devices in a safe way. 

🔴 Talk about which sites or apps might be unsafe and why?

😃 Praise Your Child for how good they are at using the web safely!

Can you and Your Child complete this task today? 🔔
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.home_activity.positive_msg: That’s great! Helping Your Child stay safe online is important so they can learn and connect with others. Well done for getting involved. They will be safer for it! 🔑
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.home_activity.negative_msg: That’s OK. Put some time aside this week to do this activity with your child. ⏰ It’s important to talk to our children about how to stay safe online so they can use the digital world to learn more and connect with others. You can do this! ⭐

Understand Child Development.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about taking care of yourself. 🌱
Understand Child Development.tips.intro: Here is a simple stretching and movement activity that may help you with stress:
Understand Child Development.tips.message.1.text:
Stand up and stretch your arms up to the sky. 
...
Push away any clouds and let the sun shine down on you. 
...
Stretch to both sides. 
...
Stretch to the front and to the back.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.2.text:
Let your hands hang by your side. 
...
Squeeze your shoulders tightly up to your ears as you breathe in, scrunch your eyes, and hold your breath. 
...
Release your shoulders as you relax your body.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.3.text:
Relax your arms and let them swing to the front and back. Take four deep breaths while you do this. This is good for your lower back.
...
Relax your arms, let them swing sideways, and turn your upper body. Your arms should gently hit your back as you twist from side to side.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.4.text: Place one foot in front of the other and make small circles from the ankles. Remember to turn to both sides. Do each foot with four circles in each direction.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.5.text: Now, shake your whole body as fast as you can. Shake it up high! Shake it down low! Shake it all around!
Understand Child Development.tips.message.6.text:
Close your eyes and raise your arms slowly above your head as you breathe in. Lower your arms slowly to your side as you breathe out. 
...
Raise and lower your arms, breathing in and out 4 more times.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.7.text:
Take a moment to reflect on your experience. 
...
Remember that you can do this activity at any time whenever you feel like you need to release stress and energise your mind and body.
Understand Child Development.video.message: ▶️Press play for a simple activity that may help you with stress.
Understand Child Development.audio.message: ▶️Press play for a simple activity that may help you with stress.
Understand Child Development.home_activity.activity: Home Activity! Try to stretch and move at least once every day. Can you try it now?
Understand Child Development.home_activity.positive_msg: Excellent. Movement will be good for your body and make such a difference in how you feel each day. ⭐
Understand Child Development.home_activity.negative_msg: That’s okay. Movement will be good for your body and make such a difference to how you feel each day. ⭐
Understand Child Development.congratulations.msg_list: Well done! 🎉 You have learnt the importance of caring for yourself and how to stretch and move your body. You have completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod lessons towards your goal “Understand Child Development”.✨

Understand Child Development.introduction.msg_list: 🧸 This lesson is about supporting Your Child to find joy in learning in a playful and fun way. 😃
Understand Child Development.importance.msg_list:
🎨 Playing with Your Child is important for their development and learning in and out of school. This is true for ALL children, including those living with physical and developmental disabilities. 

🚲 Did you know that playing also helps Your Child learn what is expected from them in the family and community and how to interact with others?
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: Children learn more when they are told what to do instead of letting them explore and play.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🎉 That’s correct! 

🌷 Did you know that children naturally explore the world around them in a creative way?

🎨 Research shows that children learn best when doing things instead of listening to instructions. 

🧸 Creating opportunities for Your Child to explore the world through play is the best way to help them learn!
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect. 

🌷 Did you know that children naturally explore the world around them in a creative way?

🎨 Research shows that children learn best when doing things instead of listening to instructions.

🧸 Creating opportunities for Your Child to explore the world through play is the best way to help them learn!
Understand Child Development.comic.intro: {F3_MOTHER} wants to spend more time helping her son, {F3_SON_4}, learn by playing together. Let’s see how both of them do it:
Understand Child Development.comic.text.1:
**{F3_MOTHER}**: “Hi, my love. Would you like to do something fun together?” 

**{F3_SON_4}**: “Ooooh yes!”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.2:
**{F3_MOTHER}**: “What would you like to do?” 

**{F3_SON_4}**: “Build a house out of bed sheets!” 

**{F3_MOTHER}**: “Great idea! What do we need to do first?”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.3:
**{F3_SON_4}**: “First, we hang one bed sheet from the top bunk bed. It’s our first wall! We can use clothing pins to keep up the sheet.”

**{F3_MOTHER}**: “Wow, well done for thinking through the steps so carefully.”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.4:
**{F3_MOTHER}**: “This is a wonderful bedsheet house, {F3_SON_4}”! 

**{F3_SON_4}**: “Can we read our bedtime story here tonight?” 

**{F3_MOTHER}**: “Yes, of course, {F3_SON_4}. That will be fun.”
Understand Child Development.tips.intro: Here are 2️⃣ two tips on how you can make learning playful and fun with Your Child:
Understand Child Development.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ GET ACTIVE

⚽ Play games!

🌱 Creating time for Your Child to play and have fun will make their physical and mental health better.

✨ It also helps them learn and remember important facts better. Isn’t that great?

⏰ If Your Child starts to feel overwhelmed with anything in their day, help them reduce their stress by taking a pause or playing together. 

💡 Use Your Child’s interests in your play or exercise sessions to get them involved. Begin with something simple and then gradually make it more complex.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ ALLOW CREATIVITY

🎨 Allow Your Child to be creative when playing. For example, encourage Your Child to draw or go outside.

✨ If Your Child is interested in a new topic, talk to them about it and help them explore the topic through play.

💙 Set a good example: Let Your Child see you being creative and trying something new, even if you are not good at it yet.
Understand Child Development.video.message:
▶️Press Play to learn some steps you can use to make learning fun for Your Child:

1️⃣ **GET ACTIVE**
2️⃣ **ALLOW CREATIVITY**

Understand Child Development.home_activity.activity: Home activity! ⭐ Invite Your Child to play with you today. Encourage them to ask questions and explore new things through play. Do you have time to do it today? ⏰
Understand Child Development.home_activity.positive_msg: Great! 💙 Use the tips you have learnt today and have fun! Playing with Your Child is a great way to motivate them to learn and develop new skills. ⚽
Understand Child Development.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! 💙 If you don't have time today, set some time aside to play together tomorrow.

Understand Child Development.introduction.msg_list: Today’s parenting lesson is about helping Your Child know how to learn from their mistakes. 💚
Understand Child Development.importance.msg_list:
Learning from our mistakes can help us avoid them in the future. 🌷

It can also help us be more supportive of ourselves and less harsh when things do not go well. 😃
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: If my child understands their mistake and says sorry, that means I can bring up other mistakes they have made so that they learn.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🌷 That’s correct! 

✨ Your Child probably feels very bad about making a mistake. Praise them for apologising and show that you are proud of them for realising and saying sorry. 💙

😔 Your Child may be tempted to hide mistakes from you out of fear if they don’t feel supported.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect. 

✨ Your Child probably feels very bad about making a mistake. Praise them for apologising and show that you are proud of them. 💙

😔 Your Child may be tempted to hide mistakes from you out of fear if they don’t feel supported.
Understand Child Development.comic.intro: {F3_DAUGHTER_7} is getting a bit too active indoors today. Let’s see how her uncle reacts:
Understand Child Development.comic.text.1:
**{F3_UNCLE}**: “{F3_DAUGHTER_7}, watch where you’re going! You’re going to break something.” 

**{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: “No I won’t!”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.2: {F3_DAUGHTER_7} runs into a table and breaks a vase. {F3_UNCLE} sees and is concerned.
Understand Child Development.comic.text.3:
**{F3_UNCLE}**: “Are you hurt??”

**{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: “No, uncle. I’m so, so sorry for breaking the vase… I didn’t see it.”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.4:
**{F3_UNCLE}**: “Thank you for realising your mistake and apologising. Do you know how you could have prevented that from happening?”

**{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: “Yes, I should have listened. I continued running even after you warned me.”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.5:
**{F3_UNCLE}**: “It’s OK, {F3_DAUGHTER_7}. I’m proud that you are able to learn from your mistakes. Let’s get a broom to sweep up the pieces. We may be able to repair the vase with some glue.”

**{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: “Okay…”
Understand Child Development.tips.intro: Here are 4️⃣ four tips that you can use to help Your Child learn from their mistakes:
Understand Child Development.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ TALK

👂 Create space and time for Your Child to talk with you about their life. 

💙 If their day was challenging, listen to them, and give space to let them share.

💛 Give them support and show you care. Tell them, "that sounds difficult.”
Understand Child Development.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ PRAISE EFFORT

💛 Praise Your Child for the effort they put into their learning even if they did not succeed.

✨ *Trying* something is more important than being able to do something perfectly.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ ALLOW FOR MISTAKES TO HAPPEN

🌱 Allow Your Child to make mistakes. Let them learn from their own mistakes so they can grow. 

❓ You may want to solve every problem for Your Child, especially when you know better. But this will not teach them to solve their own problems. 

😃 Talk to Your Child about their mistakes and allow them to figure out a way to solve their problems and do better next time.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ SHARE

📖 Try and share your own mistakes with Your Child and discuss how those helped you develop and grow. 

✅ This helps Your Child learn that you do not have to be perfect all the time.

2️⃣ **PRAISE EFFORT**
3️⃣ **ALLOW FOR MISTAKES TO HAPPEN**
4️⃣ **SHARE**

Understand Child Development.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about helping you support Your Child’s healthy development as they grow and change. ✨
Understand Child Development.importance.msg_list:
Children have different abilities at different stages of their development. 🌱

It is important to be aware of Your Child’s skills at this stage. ⚽

This helps you plan activities for them that match what they can do and helps you have realistic expectations of them. ✨
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: All children develop at the same speed as each other.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
✅Correct! 

✨ Each child is unique and will develop at their own pace. Some children may develop faster than others in some ways, while some may take more time.

💚 It is important that parents are patient and supportive, recognising that every child has their own individual path of development. 

❗ Remember that issues with your child’s development are not always obvious, and your child’s condition is NOT your fault.

🚩 If you have concerns about Your Child's development, you should seek help from a professional to get support and advice.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That is incorrect.

✨ Each child is unique and will develop at their own pace. Some children may develop faster than others in some ways, while some may take more time.

💚 It is important that parents are patient and supportive, recognizing that every child has their own individual path of development. 

❗Remember that issues with your child’s development are not always obvious, and your child’s condition is NOT your fault.

🚩 If you have concerns about Your Child's development, you should seek help from a professional to get support and advice.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.2.question: Let's do another one! True or False: It is OK to let Your Child continue trying to do something a few times even if they are not doing it correctly.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct:
✨ That’s correct! 

🚲 Your Child wants to learn, and you should support them to continue trying, even if they get it wrong.

⭐ Praise them for wanting to try! Your Child will feel supported. Trying is more important than being good at something.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect. 

🚲 Your Child wants to learn, and you should support them to continue trying, even if they get it wrong.

⭐ Praise them for wanting to try! Your Child will feel supported. Trying is more important than being good at something.
Understand Child Development.comic.intro: {F1_DAUGHTER_2} and her father, {F1_FATHER} are spending time together. Let’s see how {F1_FATHER} encourages his daughter to keep on trying:
Understand Child Development.comic.text.1:
**{F1_FATHER}**: “{F1_DAUGHTER_2}, I have 5 minutes to spend some time with you. What would you like to do?”

**{F1_DAUGHTER_2}**: “Let’s build a tower using blocks, {F1_FATHER}!”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.2:
**{F1_DAUGHTER_2}**: “I’m not good at this…”

**{F1_FATHER}**: “I can see that you are upset, {F1_DAUGHTER_2}. It’s not easy but let’s try again. I know you can do it.”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.3:
**{F1_FATHER}**: “Wow! A tower of 10 blocks! You seem really proud to have made it to ten, {F1_DAUGHTER_2}!”

**{F1_DAUGHTER_2}**: “Let’s try 15!”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.4: **{F1_FATHER}**: “I am very happy to be able to spend this special time with you, {F1_DAUGHTER_2}!”
Understand Child Development.tips.intro:
At this stage of development, children are curious about their surroundings and want to learn how to do things on their own. 🌷 

They will begin to explore the world more and express themselves using emotions and language, too. 😃😒😔😣

To support the healthy development of Your Child, use these 3️⃣ three tips:
Understand Child Development.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ BE PATIENT

⏰ Be patient while they learn new things. They may struggle at first, but with time and practice, they will succeed. 

⭐ You can also support them by helping them break large tasks into smaller tasks appropriate for their age.

💚 Use words of encouragement to motivate them and praise each step.

🌷 Your Child may express feelings dramatically. This is OK! Your Child will learn to name and manage their emotions over time.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ EXPLORE SAFELY

 🚲 Your Child will become more curious and do more by themselves as they observe the world around them. Be aware of what they do, but encourage them to experience fun activities safely!

🌱 If Your Child wants to do tasks on their own, such as tying their own shoelaces or combing their own hair, you can teach them and help them do it safely.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ ENCOURAGE SHARING

🧸 Your Child may not like to lose or take turns, but sharing can be taught, especially through play!

🏆 Praise Your Child when they share their things with others.
Understand Child Development.video.message:
At this stage of development, children are curious about their surroundings and want to learn how to do things on their own. 🌷 
They will begin to explore the world more and express themselves using emotions and language, too. 😃😒😔😣
▶️ Press play to learn 2️⃣ two tips for supporting healthy development in Your Child.

✨ Each child is unique and will develop at their own pace. Some children may develop faster than others in some ways, while some may take more time.

💚 It is important that parents are patient and supportive, recognising that every child has their own individual path of development. 

❗Remember that issues with your child’s development are not always obvious, and your child’s condition is NOT your fault.

Understand Child Development.quiz.content.2.question: Let’s do another one! True or False: It is OK to let Your Child continue trying to do something a few times even if they are not doing it correctly.

✨ That’s correct! 

🚲 Your Child is excited to try new things, and you should support them by explaining patiently, even if they get it wrong.

⭐ Praise them for wanting to try! Your Child will feel supported. Trying is more important than being good at something.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect:

🚲 Your Child is excited to try new things, and you should support them by explaining patiently, even if they get it wrong.

⭐ Praise them for wanting to try! Your Child will feel supported. Trying is more important than being good at something.
Understand Child Development.comic.intro: {F1_SON_5} is trying to put on his shoes.
Understand Child Development.comic.text.1:
**{F1_FATHER}**: “Let me put your shoes on.”

**{F1_SON_5}**: “No, I want to do it myself!”

**{F1_FATHER}**: “Okay, {F1_SON_5}, you can do it yourself.”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.2:
**{F1_SON_5}**: “I can’t do it!”

**{F1_FATHER}**: “Yes, you can! Can I help you with one foot, and you do it with the other?”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.3:
**{F1_SON_5}**: “Okay.”

**{F1_FATHER}**: “Hold your shoe in both your hands. Now, place your left foot in the shoe. Almost there! Wiggle your toes and make sure your heel is all the way in. Well done! Now, you try with your right shoe.”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.4:
**{F1_SON_5}**: “I did it!” 

**{F1_FATHER}**: “Great job, {F1_SON_5}! You are becoming such a big boy!”
Understand Child Development.tips.intro:
At this age, children love playing and learning through actions. 🚲 

From these activities, they learn what is expected of them and how to interact with others. They will have a lot of questions about their environment. ✨

Here are 2️⃣ two tips to support the healthy development of Your Child at this age.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ LEARN BY PLAYING

⚽ Play, play, play! Through play, Your Child will develop relationships with other children and understand how to interact with others.

🚲 Your Child may not like to lose, share, or take turns, but losing and taking turns can be taught! Playing is a great way to do this!

🏆 Praise Your Child when they follow the rules, accept defeat, or play nicely with others.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ SUPPORT CURIOSITY

🧸 Your Child may find it hard to know fantasy from the real world, so they may express feelings in a bigger way than needed. That is alright! Your Child will learn to manage their emotions. 😃😒😔😣

🌱 Your Child may talk a lot and have many questions. You can give Your Child short but honest answers. 

💡 Your Child may repeat the question or ask follow-up questions to learn more. Take a pause and be calm as you support their interest in learning and continue to answer.

▶️Press Play to learn about some steps for supporting healthy development in Your Child:
1️⃣ **LEARN BY PLAYING**
2️⃣ **SUPPORT CURIOSITY**
